intro: Aster cordifolius var. moratus, commonly known as the heart-leaved aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall, typically in shades of purple or blue. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and wetland restoration projects.
